entry.title: The second day of word 10000
entry.content: acrobat [ˈækrəbæt] n 杂技演员 acrobatics [ˌækrəˈbætɪks] n杂技 <-cs表示学科，economics经济学，acro 表示高，bat表示走，在高处走的像蝙蝠一样的人> acrophobia[,ækrə’fəubiə] n 恐高症 hydrophobia [ˌhaɪdrəˈfəubiə US -ˈfou-] n 狂犬病<恐水症> aerobatics [ˌeərəˈbætɪks ]n特技飞行 <aero-表示air,在空气中飞行> aerobics [eəˈrəubɪks US eˈrou-] n 有氧运动 -bat-还可以表示击打(to beat) abate [əˈbeit] v 缓解，减轻，减少 ​ <a表示否定，不再击打> ​ The medicine can abate your pain. rebate [ˈribeit] n退还款<打回你的卡里> baton [ˈbætɔn] n ①police 警棍 ②conductor 指挥棒 [GRE人及其使用工具]<-on作为后缀表示小，和-et-let 同，如electron 电子，“打人的小东西”→警棍> battalion [bəˈtæliən] n 军营，军队<联想battle> addle [ˈædl] v ①使困惑confuse ②表示腐坏<反复增加，不断add所以困惑了，双写加le 表示动作的反复> addle one’s brain sth addles my brain= I was confused by sth addled eggs 腐坏的鸡蛋 baffle [ˈbæfəl] v 让人迷惑 Your questions baffle me completely. <婴儿babble很让人baffle> bewilder [biˈwildə] v 令人困惑=confuse ，使惊慌失措，不知所措<be起到加强语气的作用，wild野外，惊慌失措了很wild，一个人在野外不知所措> I was bewildered by the skirts. 我让这些裙子弄花眼了（指不知道如何选择了） adept [ˈædept] a 熟练的 adapt [əˈdæpt] v适应<apt来自appropriate合适的> adopt [əˈdɔpt] v收养采纳<来自option> adopted son 养子 adoptive \foster mother养母 deft [deft] a灵巧的，熟练地 ​ adroit [əˈdrɔit] a 熟练地，灵巧的（口齿） <a表示加强，drive表示驱动，“使动起来”> inept [iˈnept] a 无能的<不熟练> inapt [inˈæpt] a 不合适的<不appropriate> adacent [əˈdʒeisənt] adj 邻近的，毗邻的，接近的<ent表示形容词后缀，ad表示加强，jac=ject=throw > ​ be ~ to reject [riˈdʒekt] v拒绝<往回扔> subjacent[sʌb’dʒeisnt] a 底层的，底下的 ejaculate [iˈdʒækjuleit] v尖叫<向外扔，声音扔出来> abject [ˈæbdʒekt] adj悲惨的，可怜的<被扔到一边>，卑鄙的 deject[di’dʒekt] v 心境低落<心情跌落下去> dejected [diˈdʒektid] adj心情低落的 conjecture [kənˈdʒektʃə] v猜测 guess <大家一起扔思想> 表“临近”： adjoin [əˈdʒɔin] vt 临近，毗邻 ​ <来自join有连接（connect）的意思> a ~s b abut [əˈbʌt] vi 临近，毗邻 <和about 同>~ on sth adjourn [əˈdʒə:n] vi延期休会 vt 中止，推迟 <ad表示加强，journ 表示day，“加强几天”→推迟> sojourn [ˈsɔdʒə:n] v 暂住 <有了住的地方所以可以去旅行> ​ When I was abroad, I ~ed in my friend’s home. diurnal [daiˈə:nəl] a白天的happening during the day <di来自day> nocturnal [nɔkˈtə:nl] a夜晚的 happening during the night <noct来自night> ~ activities defer [diˈfə:] v ①推迟，和delay相同 <fer表示carry搬，带来，“往下放”表示延迟> ②顺从于，defer to sb conference [ˈkɔnfərəns] n 会议 confer [kənˈfə:] v ①negotiate ②授予 ~ sb a degree. adulterate [əˈdʌltəreit] v 掺杂 反义：purify 提纯 成人三部曲 adultery [əˈdʌltəri] n 通奸<男男女女掺杂在一起> adulate [ˈædʒuleit] v 奉承，谄媚<成人说假话> altercate[‘ɔ:ltəkeit] v 争吵argue with other people<c表示吵> alternate [ɔ:lˈtə:nit, ˈɔ:ltə:neit] v交替，轮流<联想alternative> alternative [ɔ:lˈtə:nətiv] adj 两者择一的；另类的 n.取舍；选择余地 altruism [ˈæltruizəm] n 利他 注意:和selfish 相反 affluence [ˈæfluəns; ˋæflʊəns] n富裕，富足 < flu-flow流> bird flu 流感 affluent [ˈæfluənt ]adj 富裕的 <加强往外流,源源不断地流淌> effluvia [i’flu:vjə] n （工厂排出的）垃圾、废物、废料rubbish effluvial [e’flu:viəl] adj 恶臭的，废弃物<排出物的味道> not fragrant flux [flʌks] n 时代变迁<时间流淌> a big change influx [ˈinflʌks] v涌入(思想上、或人群的涌入) ​ <in-表示进入的感觉> superfluous [su:ˈpə:fluəs, sju:-] adj 多余的，过量的，过剩的 ​ <super-: ①.超级 ②.on ③. more than过多,过得过多,超级无敌流> fluctuate [ˈflʌktʃueit] vi波动，浮动（图表作文） ​ go up and down> ​ ~ between a and b flush [flʌʃ] =blush [blʌʃ] v脸红；冲水 ~the toilet affront [əˈfrʌnt] n 公开侮辱，轻蔑 vt冒犯 blame sb in public confront [kənˈfrʌnt] v 冲突<面对面> be confronted with=be faced with confrontation [ˌkɔnfrənˈteɪʃən US ˌkɑːn-] n 冲突 effrontery [eˈfrʌntəri] n厚颜无耻 <把脸放在外面，不要脸，喜欢抛投露脸，shameless, e-ex外面,ex与 ef 相同> frontier [ˈfrʌntiə] n 前线，国家边界 revile [riˈvail] v 辱骂，诽谤侮辱 <re再一次→加强+ evil ,vile表示恶毒→evil> vilify [ˈvilifai] v 辱骂，斥责，诽谤 abuse [əˈbju:z] v 谩骂（也是一种诋毁）,滥用 <ab+ use> peruse [pəˈru:z] v 仔细读，精读 <per-away远离，先理论，不实践> ​ ~ a book=read the book carefully disabuse [ˌdisəˈbju:z] v ①.纠正，②.消除错误观念 [GRE] ​ <dis-反向前缀，“不要滥用”表示correct> unused [ˌʌnˈju:zd] adj 未使用的未开发的天然的 ​ an ~ beach=natural beach disuse [dɪsˈjuːs] v 弃用abandon to use sth agrarian [əˈgreəriən] adj 有关土地的，耕地的[GRE] <agri-field，和土地有关> agriculture [ˈægrikʌltʃə] n 农业 agrononomy 农学

entry.title: The first day of word 10000
entry.content: Introduction about methods to memorize 词根词缀记词法 prefix——a.肯定、否定 b.方向suffix——词性 root——意义 womanish [ˈwuməniʃ] adj 形容男人很女<具有女人的性质> -ish表示具有……的性质（selfish 自私的） manish [mæniʃ]adj 形容女人男性化的女人 womanly [ˈwumənli] adj 女人有女人味的 manly [ˈmænli] adj 阳刚的 根的逆推：根据熟词反过来推 regress [rɪˈgres] v后退，退步<向后走> （词根词缀不是用来猜测单词的） ingress [ˈingres] v 进入<走进来> improvise [ˈimprəvaiz] v 即兴创作to do sth without preparation. <不用提前看的 -vis表示看visible可视的，例：visit -vis：see -it：to go （边走边看） im-表示否定 impossible> benefactor [ˈbeniˌfæktə] n 行善者，施主 itinerant [aiˈtinərənt] adj 巡回的，游历的 n巡回的人，有力的人 <去-ant it- 走 -iner:-inner在内部 在内部来回游走> Etymology词源shelter [ˈʃeltə] n,v 避难所，保护 <来自shell 贝壳→保护> shield [ʃi:ld] n 盾牌，保护 <同样来自shell i与e发生通假变化> fetter [ˈfetə] n 束缚，脚镣 <ter去掉， 来自foot> 词源的变化规则 ① 原音之间可以互换 a,e,i,o,u,y feasible [ˈfi:zəbəl] a 可行的（ible=able feas=fac=fact 原音和原音字母组合之间替换，s 和c发生替换） a ~ plan ② 辅音之间p\b,t\d,k\g\c\qu,f\v,s\z\x\th可以互换，因为发音的嘴型相同。 disburse [disˈbə:s] v支付、付款pay for <burse=purse dis=①away分开 ②否定 “离开钱包”> reimburse [ˌri:imˈbə:s] v报销、偿还return\give back money to <钱重新(re)回到钱包> kindle [ˈkindl] v 点燃to light up sth <来自 candle> sunder [ˈsʌndə] v 分开，裂开 miscellaneous [ˌmisəˈleiniəs] adj混杂的，各种各样的different kinds of <去掉-aneous，mis=mix cell 细胞 混杂的各种各样的细胞 > masquerade [ˌmæskəˈreid] n 假面舞会，化装舞会 <masqu=mask k与qu发生通假，-ade表示集合> blush [blʌʃ] v，n 脸红 ③ 形近字母的互换，u/v/w, m/n的互换 renovate [ˈrenəuveit] v 翻新 <-nov=new re+ new再一次变得新>~ my house lurk [lə:k] v 潜伏，埋伏to wait for sb\sth secretly ​ <联想lower ，相当lowerk u,v,w通假可能去掉原音> ④ 字母g、h的脱落（不发音） arduous [ˈɑ:djuəs] a辛苦费力的，困难的，艰难的 to do something with great difficulty <去掉-ous，相当于harduous> ⑤ 固定转换，s/t/d, p/b/f/v/ph sentimental [ˌsentiˈmentl] adj 感伤的，多愁善感的 assent [əˈsent] v 强烈的同意 strongly agree with <a加辅音双写都表示一个动作的加强，产生强烈的感觉> ~to consent [kənˈsent] v 同意<共同的感觉> dissent [diˈsent] v 不同意disagree <感觉不一样> resent [riˈzent] v 痛恨、憎恶<反（re）感（-sent）> amorphous [əˈmɔ:fəs] adj 无形状的，不定型的 <-ous去掉，a表示否定，例：symmetry n 对称 asymmetry 不对称 morph表示形状，首尾字母颠倒，没有形状的> pyre [paiə] n柴火，火葬用的柴火 <来自fire> 字母组合规律（多适用于单音节词汇）① sp 表示发出，散开，产生 spout [spaut] 喷出 spy spread spit spur [spə:] n刺激，马刺 spawn [spɔ:n] v 产卵 sperm [spəːm US spəːrm] n精子 ② scr, sc 多和手上的动作有关（注意：s在造词的时候无意义，只起到加强语气的作用） scroll [skrəul] n 卷轴 scratch [skrætʃ] v抓 slim [slim] a 苗条的 <s加强，line> 联想法记单词① 单音节词汇 找形近词 fiend [fi:nd] n 恶魔、恶人<很像friend，有r→花的是朋友，没花的是恶魔> flagrant [ˈfleigrənt] a （形容名声）臭名昭著的<“l”想掏粪的粪勺> fragrant [ˈfreigrənt] a芳香的<r是一朵花> gaunt [gɔ:nt] a 憔悴的<考GRE的姑姑> flaunt [flɔ:nt] v 炫耀show off <飞起来的姑姑> bony [ˈbəuni] a 骨瘦如柴的，骨感的 ② 多音节词汇要拆词，要拆成认识的词根词缀，拼音等 chrysanthemum [kriˈsænθəməm] n菊花 pestilence [ˈpestiləns] n 瘟疫 <ence没有用表示名词词性，前面是pest害虫→拍死它，害虫所引发的疾病> morose [məˈrəus] a郁闷的<情人节没有rose> unhappy\depressed precarious [priˈkeəriəs] a.不安全的；不牢靠的，不稳固的 be dangerous\ unstable <pre之前 –ous 形容词后缀 一个车(car)前面很危险> avalanche [ˈævəlɑ:nʃ] n 雪崩<一个人瞪大眼睛看见雪崩拦车> plethora [ˈpleθərə] 过剩、大量 <ple→plenty> gambol [ˈgæmbəl] 嬉戏、雀跃 <来自game> cantankerous [kænˈtæŋkərəs] (bad tempered) 脾气暴躁的 <tanker→anger> The first day —–Fighting! acclivity [əˈkliviti] n 向上的陡坡an ascending slope -clivi=cliff n 悬崖 declivity [diˈkliviti] n 下坡 a descending slope proclivity [prəˈklivəti] n倾向 tendency <向前弯> recline [riˈklain] v 身体后弯，倚靠，斜躺<re-表示向后> ramp\ list\ shelve 熟词辟义都和倾斜有关 list [list] v 表示倾斜 be up right 垂直的 shelve [ʃelv] v ①.倾斜 <来自shelf——放杂志的架子倾斜> ②. table v 搁置，暂不考虑 <将东西放在桌子上> 反义词是consider ramp [ræmp] n 斜坡、坡 <通往camp的斜坡> husband [ˈhʌzbənd] adj 节俭的 lessen [ˈlesən] v 减少 lesson [ˈlesən] n课 vocation [vəuˈkeiʃən] n 职业 vacation [vəˈkeiʃən, veiˈkeiʃ(ə)n] n 假期 abjure [əbˈdʒuə]v宣布放弃 放弃权利，信仰 abandon <ab-表示away 一种远离 如normal—abnormal, –jure表示发誓 to swear，在法庭上的宣誓的行动，jury陪审团> adjure [əˈdʒuə] v恳求beg, please <ad-表示加强，加强发誓> conjure [ˈkʌndʒə] v ①恳求 ②do a magic 变魔术 <一起发誓> perjure [ˈpə:dʒə] v作伪证a false evidence ​ <per①through 如permanent a永久的 ②away这里指“背离誓言”> “放弃”系列（三个for 两个 re**） forgo [fɔ:ˈgəu] v 放弃美好的事物 forgo the earthly pleasure 放弃世俗的快乐 forsake [fəˈseik] v放弃( forsook ,forsaken) 是abandon的正式版 forswear [fɔ:ˈsweə] v 宣誓放弃 renounce [riˈnauns] v放弃<和announce同源 >~authority, power, belief relinquish [riˈliŋkwiʃ] v不情愿地放弃，勉强地放弃unwilling to abandon sth <-ish作为动词结尾出现，来自link 链接，链接回到过去的日子很不情愿> abominate [əˈbɔmineit]v 痛恨hate , dislike ~ sb\ sth ominous [ˈɔminəs] a 凶兆的 abhor [əbˈhɔ:] vt 厌恶 detest [diˈtest] v 痛恨<de-表示反向，取消，向下，除去，学生希望取消考试因为痛恨,再如deforest砍伐森林\ dehydrate 脱水> contest [kənˈtest, ˈkɔntest] n,v竞争 beauty contest protest [prəˈtest, ˈprəutest] n,v抗议<提前考试学生表示抗议> attest [əˈtest] v 证明<加强考试> ~ to sth loathe [ləuð] v痛恨<中间有一个o，痛恨干活痛恨拉车床 > loath adj.憎恶的 ​ lathe [leið] n车床<la-拉能拉动的> seethe [si:ð] v 沸腾，兴奋，excite<看到冠词很激动> soothe [su:ð] v 安抚，使平息make sb calm down ；~ the crying baby blithe [ˈblaið] a 快乐的be happy；轻浮的，反义词是**serious** ​ <来自bliss → bless 上帝保佑幸福快乐> ~ life scythe [saið] n 大镰刀 <联想scissors剪子 > abstain [əbˈstein]禁绝，放弃 <ab-放在 t,s 之前时中间一般加一个s 之后abs和ab是相同的；-tain-表示to keep；“不再保持、远离”>；~ from doing，放弃做； ~ voting abandon one’s strong desire禁欲 obtain [əbˈtein] v 获得<ob表示加强或者相反> distain [ˈdistəns] v 贬低，诋毁spoil sb’s reputation <dis表示否定和分开> ； ~ sb disdain [disˈdein] v 轻视look down upon ；~ sb detain [diˈtein] v扣留，关押 I was ~ed to the police station . ​ <de表示向下，保持下来> pertain [pəˈtein] v属于 belong to\ refer to\ about ​ <per=through 一直由一个人来保持> appertain [ˌæpəˈteɪn US -ər-] 同上<a加辅音双写，加强保持> abstinence [ˈæbstɪnəns] n 禁欲 absolve [əbˈzɔlv] v 赦免，原谅 ~ sb <事情解决了，你可以离开了> abscond [əbˈskɔnd] v 潜逃 escape secretly[GRE类比中的偷偷与一般（再如wait & lurk ）] <con表示一起> abstract [ˈæbstrækt] a 抽象的 -tain=to keep pertinent [ˈpə:tinənt] adj相关的relevant 反义：impertinent sustain [səˈstein] v 保留，供养，维持；支持；经受 ​ sustainable development maintain [meinˈtein] v保持，支持 retain [riˈtein] v 保留 “tain”的高频变体ten: tenor [ˈtenə] n 男高音<保持音调的人> tenet [ˈtenit] n信条，原则 <et、let表示“小的”名词后缀，保持在内心的小东西> booklet [ˈbuklit] n小册子 leaflet 传单 tenacious [tiˈneiʃəs] a固执的stubborn ​ <-acious表示很多的，保持得过多，不接受别人的观点> mulish [mjuːlɪʃ] adj 固执的 <具有mule的性质→固执 -ish表示具有……性质> loquacious [ləuˈkweiʃəs] a 话多的<loqu=log表示说话 dialogue同源 > tenable [ˈtenəbəl] a观点能站的住脚的<able表示能，能保持得住的> ​ ~theory sustenance [ˈsʌstənəns] n 维持，粮食food & nutrition <维持你生命的东西,sus是sub的变形，在下面支持> countenance [ˈkauntinəns] n 支持，face & looking <coun是con的变形，一起维持> acerbic [əˈsəːbɪk US -əːr-] a 酸的 ~ comments 尖酸的评论 acerb= acr= ac 表示酸 ，尖锐的（sour, sharp） exacerbate [igˈzæsəbeit] v恶化，变坏 worsen <-ate表示动词后缀，ex表示前缀①出，②加强，“加强酸”> acrid [ˈækrid] a 尖刻的，辛辣的< ac就是酸> arid [ˈærid] a干旱的，干的 <r只有一朵花所以很干旱> acrimonious [ækriˈməuniəs] a 尖酸刻薄的 acrimony [ˈækriməni] n 刻薄<-moni表示警告，警告很尖刻> acumen [əˈkjumən, əˈkju:mən] n 精明,敏锐<尖尖的男人很敏锐> acme[ˈækmi] n 事业的顶峰 top\peak reach the ~ of his career acne [ˈækni] n粉刺 <脸上长包就是因为酸性物质过多。我达到事业顶峰，你长了一脸粉刺> acupuncture [ˈækjʊˌpʌŋktʃə US -ər] n,v 针灸 <ac-用尖尖的东西扎你> acquiesce [ˌækwiˈes] n 默许，勉强同意 <ac表示加强，逐渐静下来>；~in sth acquire [əˈkwaiə] v 获得 -esce v -escent adj -escence n 不同词性——*表示逐渐怎样 adolescence [ˌædəuˈlesəns] n 青少年 <逐渐有了成人的特点> effervescence[ˌefəˈvesənt US ˌefər-]n 液体的沸腾冒泡 efflorescence [ˌefləˈresəns] n开花，花旗 quiescent [kwaiˈesənt] a 静止的 quiescence n.静止 反义：motion acquittal [əˈkwitl] n 宣判无罪 guilty 有罪 <ac表示加强，当场quit→释放，退出法庭 acquit sb of sth 宣判无罪 反义：convict convict sb of sth 宣判某人有罪 <vict-表示征服，一起把你征服→宣判有罪> quittance [‘kwitəns] n赦免，释放 requite [riˈkwait] v报答reward sb with sth 同：reward ​ <这次释放了你，以后回来报答> ​

entry.title: Exam Writing 1 about motivation
entry.content: Exam Writing 1 About MotivationThe topic “The level of pay is the most significant factor in influencing employee motivation.” Discuss. You must refer to Input text 1 and Input text 2 and you can use your own observations. Write at least 500 words. My essayIntroduction There is not doubt that better motivation could lead to higher work efficiency. However, the most effective approach to provide incentives is controversial. Some experts claim that salary is the most significant motivation source for all the employees. This essay will argue that although money can meet the fundamentally physical need, it is still not the most vital incentives for staff of individual differences and tremendous impacts pf intrinsic rewards. best —- the most effective is —- meet the need staff(uncountable) BP1 It has been argued that economic incentives as a form of extrinsic rewards has a dominant influence on staff’ efficiency. According to the theorist F.W. Taylor’s experiment in steel factory, the total steel yield was 3 times than before when bonuses were not given to those hard-working employees (Input text 1). It seems that the rational- economic concept of motivation is appropriate. However, Herzberg’s two factor theory disagrees with this point. He suggests that people will not work harder if they have enough money(Input text 1). For some other high-skilled employees, normal economic reward could not satisfy the demands and they always prefer other intrinsic rewards. BP2 Intrinsic motivation play a significant role in employees’ work efficiency. There are many kinds of intrinsic rewards which give workers self-esteem and happiness of helping others. For example, 12.7 million people in England volunteered once a month(Input text2). It is obvious that their purpose is not pay and they enjoy this process by being aware of their value and meaning. The happiness of helping others also can stimulate workers’ abilities. The study held by Time magazine demonstrates that students who know their calling is really helpful to people have more enthusiastic , leading to nearly 2 times profits than before(Input text 2). Happiness and self-appreciation are gained in this work experience, which encourages them to be more willing to work, even though they do not get much money. BP3 Individual differences should be noticed when considering the most effective motivation for employees, no matter intrinsic rewards or extrinsic rewards. Money is merely a physiological need, which is at the bottom of the Maslow’s hierarchy of needs(Input text 1). There are many other higher levels in this hierarchy, which is suitable to used to explain different status of employees’ motivation prefer. For example, the significant difference between workers in factory and designers in Apple is that those workers need to follow specific rules strictly in case of being discharged. However, for designers in Apple, instead of concerning regulations and salaries, they prefer to chase esteem and self- actualization(Input text 1). Therefore, different status of employees may have different objectives, resulting in various motivation source. Conclusion Money indeed has strong effects on employees’ motivation, particularly for those some low- paid or unskilled employees. However, the argument that salary is the most important factor can not perfectly applied to all the employees since there are individual differences and important effects of other intrinsic rewards. The most efficient method to provide best motivation for single employee is to consider intrinsic and extrinsic rewards at the same time, noticing individual differences. Problems Lack of cohesion among sentences and paragraphs. lack of roadmap—-no clear sub-points Not academic enough complicate sentences without clear meaning Improvement Cohesion : link with smooth transitions: Aside from, In additional, Moreover adversative relation : However, while, Even though, It is true that This sample thesis statement : Even though the level of pay is the prime motivation factor. Social needs and sense of achievement are more effective tools of motivation. PS : Concession + own stands with two aspects of analyzation(out and in) Sample essay Introduction Give a definition about the main topic show the purpose and importance of this topic different opinions main thesis statement clear roadmap BP1 “It can be claimed that” to show the counter argument Basic structure of citing theory generalization+ specific examples + implication specific examples + general theory 1 + general theory 2 BP2 “Even though” show the turning trend Theory generalization+ specific examples + implication Linking : “This was evident in” , “This is evidence of” BP3 In addition Theory generalization+ specific examples + implication linking: “This means”, “This negativity would contribute to”,”this demonstrate that” Conclusion Concession + main argument General reasons some authorities agree two sub-points

entry.title: Silence of the lambs
entry.content: Silence of the lambsThe original ending **In the original ending, Lecter is cutting orange segments with a small paring knife, while he speaks to Clarice. As he hangs up the phone, the camera shot widens. We discover that he is at a desk in a book lined office. There is the body of a bodyguard on the floor, and then we see Lecter is not alone. Chilton is trussed up in a chair across from him, the same method of restraints the doctor used on Lecter earlier in the movie. Lecter rises, slowly, a dreamy gleam in his eye, as he approaches his terrified victim, paring knife in hand. “Shall we begin?” **

entry.title: The book thief movie review
entry.content: The book thief movie review This film is adapted from the 2005 young-adult bestseller by Australian writer Markus Zusak. The leading character is —Liesel, a young girl in 1930s Germany who is left to kindly but harassed foster parents Hans and Rosa by her fugitive Communist mother. The brutal reality of the Holocaust is not dwelt upon. It is this trio’s courage and victimhood that take center-stage.** Liesel is forced to join the Hitler Youth, but is secretly disgusted by the Nazis’ book-burning displays and conceives a love of literature by “borrowing” books from the Mayor’s wife. And as war breaks out, she is taught to love writing by Max, the Jew that her foster parents are hiding in the cellar, and whose deferential friendship and gratitude are the guarantee of their good-Germanness. It is true that this lite-historical tosh has absolutely nothing in common with the power of Steven Spielberg’s Schindler’s List. It’s a worryingly lenient and obtuse approach to history and historical evil, which are smothered in feelgood tragi-sentimental slush. “The Book Thief” has its moments of brilliance, thanks in large part to an adept cast. But the movie about a girl adopted by a German couple during World War II also crystallizes the perils of book adaptations. Based on a bestselling novel, the movie tries heartily to contain writer Markus Zusak’s myriad plot points, but the result is a rushed conclusion, which tempers the intended tear-jerking climax. The sticky-fingered title character is Liesel. With bouncy blond hair and big, sad eyes, actress Sophie Nélisse utterly embodies the character of a girl given up for adoption shortly after her brother dies. When Liesel’s on-the-run Communist mother can no longer care for her, she’s taken in by Hans (Geoffrey Rush) and Rosa (Emily Watson). The child immediately bonds with her new father, a smiling accordion player who calls Liesel “your majesty.” Rosa is more standoffish and looks constantly for excuses to yell. (She finds many.) Despite her tendency to pick up lost books, Liesel can’t read or write, and that momentarily makes her a punch line at school. One bully learns quickly, though, that although Liesel can’t spell, she can fight, and that’s just the first hint of her tenacious personality. After Hans teaches her to read, Liesel’s world begins to expand, both through stories from books she sneakily “borrows” and in a reality that’s informed by an oppressive regime. In this small German village, she finds reasons to be optimistic thanks to a friendship with another youngster, Rudy (Nico Liersch), but she also comes to understand the saddest repercussion of Third Reich rule after a man named Max comes to the family’s door one night. The son of Hans’s old friend, Max is Jewish and on the run, and he ends up hiding in the family’s basement. There is plenty here to create both an emotional payoff and a healthy dose of suspense. But director Brian Percival’s film squanders the opportunities by squeezing a number of other subplots into the two-hour run time. These threads have the space to breathe and evolve in a novel, but when it comes to the film, less would have been more. That being said, “The Book Thief” has its pleasures. Along with a memorable performance from Nélisse, Rush and Watson prove their impressive range. Despite the film’s dark themes, there are a number of scenes of gentle comedy, and those come mostly thanks to Rush’s and Watson’s facial expressions and delivery. Ben Schnetzer, who plays Max, hasn’t acted in many films, but his performance is indelible as an older brother figure trying to protect his young friend from the sad realities of the day. From the pristinely shot scenes of a train chugging through a snowy landscape that open the film, “The Book Thief” has a sleekness to it. That feeling is mirrored in a plot that feels whitewashed in some ways. For example, Rosa discusses cutting back on meals now that the family has to provide for its refu­gee, but there aren’t depictions of hunger or suffering. Just as Max tempers the reality for Liesel, the movie does the same for its viewers. That ensures a PG-13 rating and a broader audience, of course. But when the delivery is blunted, the audience’s emotions will tend to follow suit. ​ The brown Chocolate color is the death’s favorite.

entry.title: Everyday RC——Ecoefficiency
entry.content: #Everyday RC——Ecoefficiency Ecoefficiency (measures to minimize environmental impact through thereduction or elimination of waste from production processes) has becomea goal for companies worldwide, with many realizing significant costsavings from such innovations. Peter Senge and Goran Carstedt see thisdevelopment as laudable but suggest that simply adopting ecoefficiencyinnovations could actually worsen environmental stresses in the future.Such innovations reduce production waste but do not alter the number ofproducts manufactured nor the waste generated from their use anddiscard; indeed, most companies invest in ecoefficiency improvements inorder to increase profits and growth. Moreover, there is no guaranteethat increased economic growth from ecoefficiency will come in similarlyecoefficient ways, since in today’s global markets, greater profits maybe turned into investment capital that could easily be reinvested inold-style eco-inefficient industries. Even a vastly more ecoefficientindustrial system could, were it to grow much larger, generate moretotal waste and destroy more habitat and species than would a smaller,less ecoefficient economy. Senge and Carstedt argue that to preserve theglobal environment and sustain economic growth, businesses must developa new systemic approach that reduces total material use and totalaccumulated waste. Focusing exclusively on ecoefficiency, which offers acompelling business case according to established thinking, maydistract companies from pursuing radically different products andbusiness models. Analyzation of the whole structureGeneral Background introduction TC VIEW(positive and negative) 3 negative consequences conclusion(positive and negative) Specific Ecoefficiency (measures to minimize environmental impact through thereduction or elimination of waste from production processes) has becomea goal for companies worldwide, with many realizing significant costsavings from such innovations. main function : BS PS: bankrupt in BS is important Peter Senge and Goran Carstedt see this development as laudable but suggest that simply adopting ecoefficiencyinnovations could actually worsen environmental stresses in the future. main function : main view(S&&C) of ecoefficiency PS: Remember the family name Include both positive and negative view “But” indicates that “negative” aspect is more important Such innovations reduce production waste but do not alter the number ofproducts manufactured nor the waste generated from their use anddiscard; indeed, most companies invest in ecoefficiency improvements inorder to increase profits and growth. main function : explain the view (negative)[1] PS : “Such” shows its connection with the previous sentence Before “but” : positive, After “but” : negative indeed : link with smooth transition Moreover, there is no guaranteethat increased economic growth from ecoefficiency will come in similarlyecoefficient ways, since in today’s global markets, greater profits maybe turned into investment capital that could easily be reinvested inold-style eco-inefficient industries. main function : explain the view (negative)[2] PS : Moreover : link with smooth transition Even a vastly more ecoefficientindustrial system could, were it to grow much larger, generate moretotal waste and destroy more habitat and species than would a smaller,less ecoefficient economy. main function : explain the view (negative)[3] PS : Even : link with smooth transition “more, than” : notice comparison Senge and Carstedt argue that to preserve theglobal environment and sustain economic growth, businesses must developa new systemic approach that reduces total material use and totalaccumulated waste. main function : attitude again and the future PS : notice “new” Focusing exclusively on ecoefficiency, which offers acompelling business case according to established thinking, maydistract companies from pursuing radically different products andbusiness models. main function : the mixture view again PS : “compelling”(P) and “distract”(G)—same as TC Vocabularies （https://www.vocabulary.com/dictionary/laudable） （https://www.vocabulary.com/dictionary/exclusively）
